TopicTitle: STS-7/E Space Shuttle (Stock NASA Replica) Still Flies in KSP 1.4.3 - Re-enters Like the Real Thing!

Articles.Content:
Neat! I'll add it to the subassemblies list. Have a craft?

Sure! There you go, in subassembly form:

Kerbal Maneuvering Unit

Also, that new cockpit looks cool. I think I'm using it...

Rune. The Mk3 usually feels a bit too big

Have a new subassembly for ya. This one is an ICBM the shuttle can carry into orbit.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

The normal one has no docking port or RCS. This missile was especially built for the military station you see. Built the whole thing using your shuttle.

Link:http:http://kerbalx.com/jackvony/Shuttle%20ICBM/download

The normal one has no docking port or RCS. This missile was especially built for the military station you see. Built the whole thing using your shuttle.

Did you give a name to your shuttle? I'm compiling a registry. I'll add you and Rune's subs to the OP shortly.

Did you give a name to your shuttle? I'm compiling a registry. I'll add you and Rune's subs to the OP shortly.

I think I'll call her the Archimeades.

I think I'll call her the Archimeades.

Perfect! Added to the registry!

And I added your and Rune's subs to the OP.

Have a new subassembly for ya. This one is an ICBM the shuttle can carry into orbit.

The normal one has no docking port or RCS. This missile was especially built for the military station you see. Built the whole thing using your shuttle.

This reminds me of the intro video for Sid Meier's Civilization Revolution. It has a space shuttle concept which has a large missile launcher in the payload bay which I always thought looked cool.
The 2nd launch of Copernicus Station will liftoff tonight. Video will hopefully be done shortly after landing. I will also show off the launch of the Von Kerman Space Telescope.

The 2nd launch of Copernicus Station will liftoff tonight. Video will hopefully be done shortly after landing. I will also show off the launch of the Von Kerman Space Telescope.

Looking forward to it!
Hey, i think i'll name mine the Nimoy (catch my reference?)

Hey, i think i'll name mine the Nimoy (catch my reference?)

Added to the roster! Have a vid or screenshot?

Hey, i think i'll name mine the Nimoy (catch my reference?)

Good memorial. The world is a little worse off with his passing.

-----------Update from KSC Mission Control----------

The Shuttle Horizon has just landed safely back at KSC. The crew is reporting a complete success of their mission.

Due to unforeseen circumstances the launch of the Nautilus has been delayed.

Nautilus will launch tomorrow with the second stage of Copernicus Station.

Good memorial. The world is a little worse off with his passing.

-----------Update from KSC Mission Control----------

The Shuttle Horizon has just landed safely back at KSC. The crew is reporting a complete success of their mission.

Due to unforeseen circumstances the launch of the Nautilus has been delayed.

Nautilus will launch tomorrow with the second stage of Copernicus Station.

Thanks for the video! Added to the OP.
If you want, I can post a craft file for the telescope. Just gotta refine it a little. Uses the Cacteye mod along with KAS.

If you want, I can post a craft file for the telescope. Just gotta refine it a little. Uses the Cacteye mod along with KAS.

Sure yes go for it!

Also I found I have a video limit of 5 on the OP, but your vids are listed as links though!

Hey, i think i'll name mine the Nimoy (catch my reference?)

I was thinking of naming mine that too. What a great guy ill miss him so much!

Beam me up Mr. Scotty, one last time.

To jump onto the bandwagon, my shuttle will be called Pathfinder. Also, I'm looking into creating more bizarre and wacky shuttles based off this one. Like Saturn-Shuttle. The plan was to strap a space shuttle onto a Saturn V.

(also, post 777)

Grats! Folks, post screenshots or vids of your shuttles to get listed!

@Ksc Mission Control:

A STS-4 Class shuttle "Columbus" is lifting to orbit later today. It is carrying the first module for "Low Lab" Station, and will also carry a Soyuz-Like space craft for the station. The crew is boarding as we speak. Liftoff in T- 10 minutes

@Ksc Mission Control:

Liftoff! Shuttle is on its way!

- - - Updated - - -

@Ksc Mission Control:

External Tank dropped. Crew will use OMS to circularize. #LowLab

- - - Updated - - -

I actually should make a KSP news thing...

- - - Updated - - -

@Ksc Mission Control:

Orbit achieved! Crew is working to get Low Lab ready!

- - - Updated - - -

@Ksc Mission Control:

Low Lab is complete. One crew member is bringing the shuttle down. Final report later with photos.

Made a military version of your shuttle to go with my recent military theme. I call it the Sherman.

I added some bdamoury parts and changed up the rudder setup. It weighs about 367 tons I think and it carries a pair of attack drones. Also has mechjeb on it already.
